questions.question_text:
An adaptive team is in the process of merging a legacy system from an acquired company. In order to check the project status and manage the flow of work, they are using a scrum board for this project.

What data should be included in this information radiator?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Explanation
In an adaptive team using Scrum methodology, the scrum board serves as an essential information radiator for tracking project progress and managing workflow. For a project involving the merger of a legacy system from an acquired company, the scrum board should primarily include the product backlog and sprint backlog.

Product Backlog: This is a prioritized list of all features, requirements, enhancements, and fixes that constitute the changes to be made to the product. In this case, it would include all the tasks necessary to merge the legacy system successfully.
Sprint Backlog: This is a subset of the product backlog, containing the items selected for the current sprint, along with the plan for delivering them. It represents the team’s immediate focus and commitment for the ongoing sprint.

The Scrum board is a visual tool in Agile that tracks work progress. It shows tasks from the product backlog (all project tasks) and the sprint backlog (tasks for the current sprint), helping the team see what’s in progress and what’s done.

Selected Answer: C
Burndown and burnup charts are essential tools in Scrum for tracking progress. They provide visibility into the remaining work (burndown chart) or the completed work (burnup chart) over time. These charts help the team and stakeholders understand if the project is on track to meet its goals and deadlines.
Key performance indicators (KPIs) and baseline measurements (option A) are used for monitoring overall project health and performance but are usually tracked separately. Product and sprint backlogs (option B) are managed and updated within the team but are not typically displayed on the scrum board itself. Increments and bottlenecks (option D) are important to identify and address during project execution but are not commonly shown on the scrum board.

questions.question_text:
Given the following information, what is the schedule variance (SV) for this project?


Early start date (ES): 16 weeks -

Actual time: 12 weeks -
Schedule performance index (SPI): 1.3

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
ES = 16
AT=EV=12

SPI = EV/PV
SV = EV-PV

1.3 = 12/PV
PV = 9.23
(To confirm : SPI=EV/PV
= 12/9.23
= 1.3 
= same with the information given.)

Thus 
SV = 12 - 9.23
SV = 2.769
SV ~ 3

SPI = EV/PV so EV =12 weeks. Based off our option PV being 2 would be 12/10 = 1.2
12/9 = 1.33333

so if PV is 15 weeks SV = EV-PV of 15-12 =3.
Based off that i'd say answer is C for 3.

questions.question_text: Which of the following activities are included as part of a project manager's responsibilities?

An agile team will begin to work on a project for a local conference. The team will deliver an information system with complete audience information, which includes many requirements. In order to begin working on the project, the team produces a checklist for a user-centric requirement that is needed to deliver the system.

Which checklist will the team produce?
When managing costs in an agile environment, what should a project manager consider?

choices.A: Lightweight estimation methods can be used as changes arise
choices.C: Agile environments make projects more costly and uncertain
choices.B: Agile environments make cost aggregation more difficult
choices.D: Detailed cost calculations benefit from frequent changes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Lightweight estimation such as Analogues, Affinity, & Three point can help estimate in an agile system where changes are frequent and exacts may not be needed if scope changes frequently

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
